metadata.description: Validate foundational knowledge of machine learning and AI concepts, and related Microsoft Azure services for AI workloads.

question.title: Understanding Artificial Intelligence
question.scenario: A company wants to implement software that can learn from data, identify patterns, and make decisions with minimal human intervention. The system should improve its performance over time as it processes more data.
question.question-text: What term best describes this type of software system?

hints.hint: Consider which technology enables systems to learn and improve from experience.
This technology mimics human cognitive functions like learning and problem-solving.
Artificial Intelligence encompasses systems that can perceive, learn, reason, and act to achieve goals.

question.title: Machine Learning Definition
question.scenario: A data science team is building a model that analyzes historical sales data to predict future sales trends. The model automatically improves its predictions as more sales data becomes available without being explicitly reprogrammed.
question.question-text: What AI discipline is being applied in this scenario?

hints.hint: Consider which discipline focuses on algorithms that learn from data.
This approach enables computers to learn without being explicitly programmed.
Machine learning is a subset of AI where algorithms learn patterns from data to make predictions.

question.title: Responsible AI Principles
question.scenario: A healthcare organization is implementing an AI system to assist doctors with diagnosis. They want to ensure the AI makes decisions that can be explained to patients, treats all patient groups fairly, and protects patient privacy.
question.question-text: Which principle of responsible AI addresses the need to explain AI decisions to stakeholders?

hints.hint: Consider which principle relates to understanding and explaining AI decisions.
This principle ensures AI systems are understandable and their decisions can be interpreted.
Transparency in AI means systems should be understandable, and decisions should be explainable.

question.title: AI Fairness Principle
question.scenario: A bank is developing an AI model for loan approval. During testing, they discover the model approves loans at different rates for different demographic groups, even when other factors are similar. The bank wants to address this bias.
question.question-text: Which responsible AI principle is most directly concerned with addressing this issue?

hints.hint: Consider which principle addresses treating all groups equitably.
This principle ensures AI systems don't discriminate against any group.
Fairness ensures AI systems treat all people equitably without bias based on demographics.

question.title: AI Workload Types
question.scenario: A retail company wants to implement AI to identify products in images uploaded by customers. The system should recognize different product types, colors, and brands from photographs.
question.question-text: What type of AI workload does this scenario describe?

hints.hint: Consider which AI workload processes and understands images.
This workload enables computers to interpret visual information from the world.
Computer vision enables AI systems to analyze and understand images and videos.

question.title: Deep Learning Concept
question.scenario: A research team is training an AI model with multiple layers of neural networks. Each layer processes features at increasing levels of abstraction, enabling the model to learn complex patterns from raw data like images or audio.
question.question-text: What machine learning approach is being described?

hints.hint: Consider which approach uses multiple layers of neural networks.
This approach is particularly effective for processing unstructured data like images.
Deep learning uses multi-layered neural networks to learn hierarchical representations of data.

question.title: Reliability and Safety
question.scenario: An autonomous vehicle company is testing their AI driving system. They need to ensure the AI behaves predictably in all conditions, handles unexpected situations safely, and minimizes risk of harm to passengers and pedestrians.
question.question-text: Which responsible AI principle is most critical for this autonomous vehicle system?

hints.hint: Consider which principle addresses consistent, safe behavior of AI systems.
This principle is especially important for AI systems that can affect physical safety.
Reliability and safety ensures AI systems perform consistently and safely in all conditions.

question.title: AI Accountability
question.scenario: A company deploying AI systems wants to establish clear governance. They need to define who is responsible for the AI's behavior, how decisions are documented, and how issues are addressed when the AI makes errors.
question.question-text: Which responsible AI principle addresses establishing responsibility and governance for AI systems?

hints.hint: Consider which principle establishes responsibility for AI behavior.
This principle ensures people are responsible for how AI systems operate.
Accountability ensures people are responsible for AI systems and their outcomes.

question.title: Knowledge Mining Workload
question.scenario: A law firm has millions of legal documents accumulated over decades. They want an AI solution that can extract key information, identify relationships between cases, and make this unstructured content searchable and analyzable.
question.question-text: What type of AI workload is best suited for this scenario?

hints.hint: Consider which workload extracts insights from large volumes of unstructured content.
This workload uses AI to make unstructured data searchable and discoverable.
Knowledge mining extracts information from large volumes of unstructured data to uncover insights.

question.title: Inclusiveness Principle
question.scenario: A technology company is designing an AI-powered application. They want to ensure the application works well for users with disabilities, users from different cultures, and users with varying levels of technical expertise.
question.question-text: Which responsible AI principle focuses on ensuring AI benefits all people?

hints.hint: Consider which principle addresses making AI accessible to diverse users.
This principle ensures AI empowers everyone and engages people of all abilities.
Inclusiveness ensures AI systems empower everyone and engage people with diverse abilities and backgrounds.

question.title: Supervised Learning
question.scenario: A data scientist is training a model to predict house prices. The training dataset includes features like square footage, number of bedrooms, and location, along with the actual sale prices of houses. The model learns from these labeled examples.
question.question-text: What type of machine learning approach is being used?

hints.hint: Consider which approach uses labeled data with known outcomes for training.
The model learns from examples where both inputs and correct outputs are provided.
Supervised learning uses labeled training data where inputs are paired with known outputs.

question.title: Unsupervised Learning
question.scenario: A marketing team wants to segment their customers into groups based on purchasing behavior. They have customer data but no predefined categories. They want the AI to discover natural groupings in the data.
question.question-text: What type of machine learning approach should be used?

hints.hint: Consider which approach finds patterns in data without predefined labels.
This approach discovers hidden structures in unlabeled data.
Unsupervised learning finds patterns and groupings in data without labeled examples.

question.title: Classification vs Regression
question.scenario: A bank wants to build a model that predicts whether a customer will default on a loan. The output should be a yes/no prediction indicating the likelihood of default based on customer characteristics.
question.question-text: What type of supervised learning task is this?

hints.hint: Consider whether the prediction is a category or a continuous value.
Predicting discrete categories like yes/no is a specific type of supervised learning.
Classification predicts discrete categories or labels, such as yes/no or categories.

question.title: Regression Task
question.scenario: An energy company wants to predict tomorrow's electricity demand in megawatts based on weather forecasts, day of week, and historical consumption patterns. The prediction should be a specific numeric value.
question.question-text: What type of supervised learning task is this?

hints.hint: Consider whether the prediction is a continuous numeric value.
Predicting a specific number like megawatts is a particular supervised learning type.
Regression predicts continuous numeric values, like quantities, prices, or measurements.

question.title: Azure Machine Learning Overview
question.scenario: A data science team needs a platform to build, train, and deploy machine learning models. They want a cloud service that provides tools for the entire ML lifecycle including experimentation, model training, and deployment.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides a comprehensive platform for machine learning?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure service is specifically designed for building custom ML models.
This service provides tools for the complete machine learning workflow.
Azure Machine Learning is a cloud platform for building, training, and deploying ML models.

question.title: Automated Machine Learning
question.scenario: A business analyst with limited data science experience needs to build a predictive model. They want a tool that automatically selects algorithms, tunes hyperparameters, and evaluates different models to find the best one.
question.question-text: What Azure Machine Learning capability helps automate the model building process?

hints.hint: Consider which feature automates algorithm selection and hyperparameter tuning.
This capability enables users to create models without extensive ML expertise.
Automated ML (AutoML) automatically selects algorithms and tunes hyperparameters to find the best model.

question.title: Training and Validation Data
question.scenario: A data scientist splits their dataset into two parts. One part is used to train the model, while the other part is held back and used to evaluate how well the model performs on data it hasn't seen during training.
question.question-text: What is the purpose of the held-back portion of data?

hints.hint: Consider why you would test a model on data it hasn't seen.
This process evaluates how well the model generalizes to new data.
Validation data is used to evaluate model performance and detect overfitting.

question.title: Model Deployment
question.scenario: After training a machine learning model, a team needs to make it available for applications to use. They want to deploy the model as a web service that can receive requests and return predictions in real-time.
question.question-text: What is the process of making a trained model available for use called?

hints.hint: Consider what happens after training when you want applications to use the model.
This process makes the model accessible as a service for predictions.
Model deployment is the process of making a trained model available for use in applications.

question.title: Features and Labels
question.scenario: A model is trained to predict whether an email is spam. The training data includes attributes like sender address, subject line keywords, and message length. Each email in the training set is marked as either "spam" or "not spam".
question.question-text: In machine learning terminology, what are the attributes used for prediction called?

hints.hint: Consider what the input variables used to make predictions are called.
These are the characteristics or attributes the model uses to learn patterns.
Features are the input variables or attributes used by the model to make predictions.

question.title: Azure ML Designer
question.scenario: A team prefers to build machine learning models using a visual drag-and-drop interface rather than writing code. They want to create pipelines by connecting components that represent data transformations and algorithms.
question.question-text: Which Azure Machine Learning tool provides a visual interface for building ML pipelines?

hints.hint: Consider which tool offers drag-and-drop model building.
This visual tool enables no-code or low-code ML development.
Azure ML Designer provides a drag-and-drop interface for building ML pipelines visually.

question.title: Anomaly Detection
question.scenario: A manufacturing company monitors sensor data from equipment. They want to automatically detect unusual patterns that might indicate equipment failure, even though they don't have many examples of past failures to train on.
question.question-text: What type of machine learning task is best suited for detecting unusual patterns?

hints.hint: Consider which task focuses on identifying outliers or unusual patterns.
This task learns what normal looks like and flags deviations.
Anomaly detection identifies unusual patterns or outliers that deviate from expected behavior.

question.title: Model Performance Metrics
question.scenario: A data scientist has trained a classification model to predict customer churn. They need to measure how well the model correctly identifies customers who will actually churn versus those who won't.
question.question-text: Which metric measures the proportion of actual positives correctly identified?

hints.hint: Consider which metric focuses on finding all actual positive cases.
This metric measures the true positive rate - how many actual positives were caught.
Recall (sensitivity) measures the proportion of actual positives correctly identified by the model.

question.title: Azure AI Vision Overview
question.scenario: A company wants to automatically extract information from images, including detecting objects, reading text in images, and generating captions. They need a pre-built AI service that doesn't require training custom models.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides pre-built computer vision capabilities?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure service offers ready-to-use image analysis capabilities.
This service provides pre-built APIs for various computer vision tasks.
Azure AI Vision (formerly Computer Vision) provides pre-built capabilities for image analysis.

question.title: Image Classification
question.scenario: A wildlife conservation organization wants to automatically identify the species of animals in photos captured by trail cameras. Each image should be labeled with the type of animal it contains.
question.question-text: What computer vision task assigns a label to an entire image based on its content?

hints.hint: Consider which task assigns a single category to an image.
This task determines what category an image belongs to as a whole.
Image classification assigns a label or category to an entire image based on its content.

question.title: Object Detection
question.scenario: A retail store wants to monitor shelf inventory using cameras. The system should identify what products are on shelves and where they are located in the image, drawing boxes around each detected product.
question.question-text: What computer vision task identifies and locates multiple objects within an image?

hints.hint: Consider which task identifies objects and their locations in an image.
This task draws bounding boxes around detected objects.
Object detection identifies and locates multiple objects within an image using bounding boxes.

question.title: Optical Character Recognition
question.scenario: An insurance company receives thousands of paper claim forms. They want to automatically extract text from scanned form images to reduce manual data entry and speed up processing.
question.question-text: What computer vision capability extracts text from images?

hints.hint: Consider which capability reads and extracts text from images.
This technology converts images of text into machine-readable text.
Optical Character Recognition (OCR) extracts printed or handwritten text from images.

question.title: Azure AI Custom Vision
question.scenario: A manufacturing company wants to train a custom model to detect defects in their specific products. They have images of products with and without defects and want to create a specialized detection model.
question.question-text: Which Azure service allows training custom image classification and object detection models?

hints.hint: Consider which service enables training custom vision models without extensive ML expertise.
This service simplifies building custom image classifiers and object detectors.
Azure Custom Vision enables training custom image classification and object detection models easily.

question.title: Face Detection
question.scenario: A security system needs to detect when people are present in camera footage. It should identify where faces appear in images and estimate attributes like age and emotion, but not identify specific individuals.
question.question-text: What computer vision capability detects and analyzes human faces in images?

hints.hint: Consider which capability specifically focuses on detecting and analyzing faces.
This capability can detect faces and analyze facial attributes.
Face detection and analysis detects faces and can analyze attributes like age, emotion, and pose.

question.title: Azure AI Document Intelligence
question.scenario: A company processes invoices from many different vendors. They need to extract specific fields like invoice number, date, line items, and total amount from invoice images, understanding the document structure.
question.question-text: Which Azure service specializes in extracting structured data from documents?

hints.hint: Consider which service extracts structured information from documents.
This service understands document layouts and extracts key-value pairs and tables.
Azure AI Document Intelligence (formerly Form Recognizer) extracts structured data from documents.

question.title: Semantic Segmentation
question.scenario: An autonomous vehicle system needs to understand road scenes at a pixel level. It must classify each pixel in an image as belonging to categories like road, sidewalk, vehicle, pedestrian, or building.
question.question-text: What computer vision task classifies every pixel in an image?

hints.hint: Consider which task assigns a class label to every pixel.
This task provides pixel-level understanding of image content.
Semantic segmentation classifies each pixel in an image into predefined categories.

question.title: Image Captioning
question.scenario: A photo sharing application wants to automatically generate text descriptions for uploaded images to improve accessibility for visually impaired users. The descriptions should summarize what's happening in each image.
question.question-text: What computer vision capability generates text descriptions of image content?

hints.hint: Consider which capability creates natural language descriptions of images.
This capability describes image content in human-readable sentences.
Image captioning generates natural language descriptions of what's depicted in an image.

question.title: Video Analysis
question.scenario: A sports analytics company wants to analyze recorded game footage. They need to track player movements, detect key events like goals, and identify players throughout the video.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides AI capabilities for analyzing video content?

hints.hint: Consider which service is specifically designed for video analysis.
This service extracts insights from video including faces, text, and scenes.
Azure Video Indexer extracts deep insights from video content including people, text, and events.

question.title: Natural Language Processing Overview
question.scenario: A company wants to build an AI system that can understand and respond to customer emails, extract key information from support tickets, and automatically categorize incoming messages by topic.
question.question-text: What field of AI deals with enabling computers to understand and process human language?

hints.hint: Consider which AI field focuses on text and speech understanding.
This field enables machines to read, understand, and derive meaning from human language.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) enables computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language.

question.title: Azure AI Language Overview
question.scenario: A company needs to analyze customer feedback to understand sentiment, extract key phrases, and identify the language of each comment. They want a pre-built service that doesn't require training custom models.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides pre-built NLP capabilities for text analysis?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure service offers ready-to-use text analysis capabilities.
This service provides pre-built APIs for understanding text.
Azure AI Language provides pre-built NLP capabilities including sentiment analysis and entity recognition.

question.title: Sentiment Analysis
question.scenario: A hotel chain collects thousands of guest reviews. They want to automatically determine whether each review expresses positive, negative, or neutral feelings about their service.
question.question-text: What NLP capability determines the emotional tone of text?

hints.hint: Consider which capability identifies emotional content in text.
This capability classifies text as positive, negative, or neutral.
Sentiment analysis determines the emotional tone or opinion expressed in text.

question.title: Named Entity Recognition
question.scenario: A news organization wants to automatically tag articles with the people, organizations, locations, and dates mentioned in the text. This helps categorize and search their content archive.
question.question-text: What NLP capability identifies and categorizes specific entities in text?

hints.hint: Consider which capability identifies specific things like people, places, and organizations.
This capability categorizes mentioned entities into predefined types.
Named Entity Recognition identifies and categorizes entities like people, places, organizations, and dates.

question.title: Language Detection
question.scenario: A global customer service center receives messages in many different languages. Before routing messages to the appropriate language team, they need to automatically identify which language each message is written in.
question.question-text: What NLP capability identifies the language of input text?

hints.hint: Consider which capability determines what language text is written in.
This capability returns the language code of the input text.
Language detection identifies which language a piece of text is written in.

question.title: Azure AI Translator
question.scenario: A multinational company needs to translate product documentation from English into 50 different languages. They want real-time translation capabilities that preserve the formatting of technical documents.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides neural machine translation capabilities?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure service focuses on language translation.
This service uses neural machine translation for high-quality translations.
Azure AI Translator provides neural machine translation across many languages.

question.title: Conversational Language Understanding
question.scenario: A company is building a virtual assistant that needs to understand user requests like "Book a flight to Seattle next Friday" and extract the intent (book flight) and entities (destination: Seattle, date: next Friday).
question.question-text: What capability enables understanding user intent and extracting entities from natural language?

hints.hint: Consider which capability understands user intent from conversational input.
This capability extracts intents and entities from user utterances.
Conversational Language Understanding identifies user intents and extracts entities from natural language.

question.title: Azure AI Speech
question.scenario: A mobile application needs to convert spoken commands into text so users can control the app hands-free. It also needs to read responses back to users using natural-sounding synthesized speech.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides speech-to-text and text-to-speech capabilities?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure service handles audio and speech processing.
This service converts speech to text and text to speech.
Azure AI Speech provides speech recognition, synthesis, and translation capabilities.

question.title: Question Answering
question.scenario: A company wants to create an FAQ bot that can answer customer questions based on their existing knowledge base documents. The bot should find and return the most relevant answer from the knowledge base.
question.question-text: What capability enables building a system that answers questions from a knowledge base?

hints.hint: Consider which capability finds answers to questions in documents.
This capability creates question-answer pairs from knowledge sources.
Question answering extracts answers from documents to respond to user questions.

question.title: Azure Bot Service
question.scenario: A company wants to build a customer service chatbot that can be deployed across multiple channels including their website, Microsoft Teams, and Facebook Messenger. The bot should handle conversations and integrate with their backend systems.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides a platform for building and deploying conversational bots?

hints.hint: Consider which service is designed for building chatbots.
This service provides a framework for developing and deploying bots.
Azure Bot Service provides tools to build, test, and deploy intelligent bots across channels.

question.title: Generative AI Concept
question.scenario: A content marketing team uses an AI tool that can write blog posts, generate images based on text descriptions, and create video scripts from prompts. The AI creates new content rather than just analyzing existing content.
question.question-text: What type of AI creates new content based on prompts or inputs?

hints.hint: Consider which type of AI produces new content rather than analyzing existing data.
This AI type generates text, images, code, and other creative content.
Generative AI creates new content like text, images, code, and music based on input prompts.

question.title: Large Language Models
question.scenario: A developer is working with an AI model trained on vast amounts of text data. The model can understand context, generate human-like text, answer questions, summarize documents, and write code based on natural language instructions.
question.question-text: What type of AI model has these broad language understanding and generation capabilities?

hints.hint: Consider which model type is trained on massive text datasets.
These models can perform various language tasks without task-specific training.
Large Language Models (LLMs) are trained on vast text data and can perform diverse language tasks.

question.title: Azure OpenAI Service
question.scenario: A company wants to integrate GPT models into their applications for tasks like content generation, summarization, and code assistance. They need enterprise-grade security, compliance, and responsible AI features.
question.question-text: Which Azure service provides access to OpenAI models with enterprise features?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure service hosts OpenAI's models.
This service combines OpenAI models with Azure's enterprise capabilities.
Azure OpenAI Service provides access to GPT, DALL-E, and other OpenAI models with enterprise features.

question.title: Prompt Engineering
question.scenario: A developer is working with a language model and discovers that the quality of responses varies significantly based on how they phrase their requests. They learn to structure inputs with clear instructions, examples, and context to get better outputs.
question.question-text: What is the practice of designing effective inputs for generative AI models called?

hints.hint: Consider what the practice of crafting effective AI inputs is called.
This practice involves designing prompts that elicit desired responses from AI.
Prompt engineering is the practice of designing effective prompts to get desired outputs from AI models.

question.title: Copilot Concept
question.scenario: Microsoft offers AI assistants integrated into products like Microsoft 365 and GitHub. These assistants help users write documents, analyze data in Excel, generate code, and complete tasks using natural language instructions within the applications they already use.
question.question-text: What term describes these AI assistants that help users accomplish tasks within applications?

hints.hint: Consider Microsoft's branding for AI assistants embedded in their products.
This term suggests an AI working alongside users to help with tasks.
Copilot is Microsoft's term for AI assistants integrated into applications to augment user productivity.

question.title: Grounding with RAG
question.scenario: A company wants their generative AI to answer questions using their internal documentation. They implement a system that retrieves relevant documents from their knowledge base and includes that content in prompts to the language model.
question.question-text: What technique enhances AI responses by including retrieved information in prompts?

hints.hint: Consider which technique combines retrieval with generation.
This approach retrieves relevant context and uses it to ground AI responses.
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) retrieves relevant information to include in prompts for grounded responses.

question.title: AI-Generated Content Risks
question.scenario: A company using generative AI for customer communications is concerned that the AI might generate inaccurate information, create content that appears factual but isn't true, or produce responses that don't align with company policies.
question.question-text: What term describes when AI generates content that sounds plausible but is factually incorrect?

hints.hint: Consider what it's called when AI produces confident but false information.
This term describes AI generating plausible-sounding but incorrect content.
Hallucination refers to AI generating content that is plausible-sounding but factually incorrect.

question.title: Azure AI Studio
question.scenario: A development team wants a unified environment to explore AI models, build generative AI applications, and deploy them. They need tools for prompt engineering, testing different models, and implementing responsible AI practices.
question.question-text: Which Azure platform provides a unified environment for building generative AI applications?

hints.hint: Consider which Azure platform is designed specifically for generative AI development.
This platform brings together tools for building AI applications with various models.
Azure AI Studio is a unified platform for exploring, building, and deploying generative AI applications.

term.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
term.definition: The simulation of human intelligence in machines programmed to think and learn like humans.

term.name: Machine Learning
term.definition: A subset of AI where algorithms learn patterns from data to make predictions without being explicitly programmed.

term.name: Deep Learning
term.definition: A subset of machine learning using multi-layered neural networks to learn complex patterns from data.

term.name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
term.definition: AI technology that enables computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language.

term.name: Computer Vision
term.definition: AI technology that enables computers to interpret and understand visual information from images and videos.

term.name: Generative AI
term.definition: AI systems that can create new content such as text, images, code, and audio based on input prompts.

term.name: Large Language Model (LLM)
term.definition: AI models trained on vast amounts of text data capable of understanding and generating human-like text.

term.name: Responsible AI
term.definition: Principles and practices for developing and deploying AI systems that are fair, transparent, safe, and accountable.

term.name: Prompt Engineering
term.definition: The practice of designing and optimizing inputs to generative AI models to achieve desired outputs.

term.name: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
term.definition: A technique that enhances AI responses by retrieving relevant information from external sources to include in prompts.

term.name: Hallucination
term.definition: When AI generates content that sounds plausible but is factually incorrect or fabricated.

term.name: Copilot
term.definition: Microsoft's term for AI assistants integrated into applications to help users accomplish tasks.
